etymology.description: 样(樣) (yàng, "appearance") + 板(板) (bǎn, "board; model") + 间(間) (jiān, "room")
etymology.interpretation: The term 样板间(樣板間) (yàngbǎnjiān, "showroom") combines 样(樣) (yàng, "appearance") to suggest an example or display, with 板(板) (bǎn, "model"), indicating a model or template, and 间(間) (jiān, "room"), referring to the physical space. Together, they describe a room that displays a model or example, often used in real estate to exhibit how a finished living space might look.
etymology.simplification: 样板间 is the simplified form of 樣板間.

examples.chinese: 他带我们参观样板间(他帶我們參觀樣板間)。
examples.english: He took us to visit the showroom.

examples.chinese: 新的样板间装修精美(新的樣板間裝修精美)，吸引了很多顾客(吸引了很多顧客)。
examples.pinyin: Xīn de yàngbǎnjiān zhuāngxiū jīngměi, xīyǐn le hěn duō gùkè.
examples.english: The new showroom is exquisitely decorated and attracts many customers.
